channel.title: Drafts on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Drafts on Home

item.title: Functional Programming for laymen, a perhaps unexplored perspective
item.description:
The core of my argument is that good functional programming requires more working memory on behalf of the operator than equivalent procedural programs. The introduction of state, which can be thought of as materializations of the events processed by the system works well with how most people model their worlds.

Humans operate on a materialized view

My wallet has a balance of 20 dollars. It isn’t a wallet with a 12.43 transaction at McDonald’s, a 15.99 charge from Netflix and a 24.00 venmo from my friend Ray, it’s got 20 dollars.

split this into two blogs, against take homes and other approaches

Research: Read 5 articles on types of technical interviews

Case Interview (case study)

I’ve never seen this, but it sounds like you propose an engineeer with a business scenario and ask the interviewee to study the problem, perform an analysis and discuss the problem in person

Seems good for those who are able to break down business problems as well as communicate
